intro: Gnidia rivae, commonly known as the river gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils along riverbanks and other moist habitats. Its leaves are simple, elliptical, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and they bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
